===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/angoː/ → /ankoː/}}

{{unk.|lang=ja|sort=あんこう}}.

Various theories of the origin of {{ja-r|あんこう}} exist, such as from {{ja-r|あんぐり}} or {{ja-r|あぐり|gloss=agape, with one's mouth wide open}},<ref>フリーランス雑学ライダーズ編『あて字のおもしろ雑学』 p.47 1988年 永岡書店</ref><ref>[[w:ja:アンコウ#.E8.AA.9E.E6.BA.90|アンコウ: 語源]], Japanese Wikipedia</ref> perhaps related to Korean {{m|ko|아귀||anglerfish}}. The kanji spelling is an Edo-period coinage, found for example in the 1709 biology text [[w:ja:大和本草|{{lang|ja|大和本草}}]] (''Yamato Honzō'', “Japanese Biology”), formed from earlier {{ateji|sort=あんこう}} {{m|ja|安康|tr=ankō}} by adding the {{m|zh|魚||fish}} [[radical#Noun|radical]] to each of the ateji characters. The current {{lang|ja|鮟鱇}} form has replaced the earlier {{ja-l|安康}} form.
